1   Then Job answered and said: 2 Even to-day is my complaint bitter; my hand is become heavy because of my groaning. 3 Oh that I knew where I might find Her, that I might come even to Her seat! 4 I would order my cause before Her, and fill my mouth with arguments. 5 I would know the words which She would answer me, and understand what She would say unto me. 6 Would She contend with me in Her great power? Nay; but She would give heed unto me. 7 There the upright might reason with Her; so should I be delivered for ever from my Judge. 8 Behold, I go forward, but She is not there, and backward, but I cannot perceive Her;
9 On the left hand, when She doth work, but I cannot behold Her, She turneth Herself to the right hand, but I cannot see Her. 10 For She knoweth the way that I take; when She hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold. 11 My foot hath held fast to Her steps, Her way have I kept, and turned not aside. 12 I have not gone back from the commandment of Her lips; I have treasured up the words of Her mouth more than my necessary food. 13 But She is at one with Herself, and who can turn Her? And what Her soul desireth, even that She doeth. 14 For She will perform that which is appointed for me; and many such things are with Her. 15 Therefore am I affrighted at Her presence; when I consider, I am afraid of Her. 16 Yea, God hath made my heart faint, and the Almighty hath affrighted me;
